title: The Little Girl in the White Dress
body:
I work as a nurse in a hospital in New York City. I'm constantly busy with patients that I hardly have a moment to myself. However, I love my job. The pay is nice and I love interacting with the patients, especially the sweet elderly ones.

I was on my shift a few months ago, a newbie at the hospital at the time. I still had a lot to learn, but at the time I had been here for a mere three months.

Anyways, I was making my beginning shift rounds, which I do at the beginning of every shift, just to make sure the patients are OK. I do this every day before I clock in. It isn't tedious and it's nice to meet the new patients. I open the door to a patient room and notice the IV bag running low. As I begin to place a new one onto the stand, I see a young girl run past.

As I follow her silently, she goes to the supply closet and closes the door behind her. When Iopen it, there is no one there, just IV stands and other typical equipment. I didn't;t think much of it...I am a nurse, I get tired and see imaginary things sometimes/ That's just how it is.

Weeks go by and I see her everywhere...in the Staff Only bathroom, in the Break Room, and in other patient's rooms. She never spoke, only ever giggled once, and she loved hiding and not being seen.

I get to a point, on this particular day where I want to know more about her...so I ask my coworker, Janet. She's on the older side, with graying hair, a sluggish look, and big brown eyes.

"oh, yeah...that's Kimmy." she says. "You'll see her a lot in your time here. She just does what she wants to." she finishes.

"She doesn't...hurt anyone does she?"

"Oh, no. Kimmy is a sweetheart. SHe's actually saved patient's lives before."

"How?"

"She appears next to their door whenever their IV is running low, and she only giggles if the patient is dying. She'd not giggling to be rude, she can't speak, so she giggles."Janet finishes.

I look at her puzzled...

"long story short...you don'r have to worry about her...she's the crowning jewel of the Intensive Care Unit."

"Ok...good to know." right as I say this my phone goes off, alerting me the it was time for my next round.

I make that round with no trouble until I get to Rhonda's room, a young woman who was in a shootout with police over her abusive husband.

"Hello, Rhonda...how are you today?" I ask politely.

"I've been better, thanks." she says bitterly.

"Do you need more morphine?" I ask.

"No! What I need is to be left at peace! I don't care what little games kids play around here, I don't want a singing youth group coming into my room!" she yells.

"Ok, Rhonda, please calm down...your blood pressure is going up." I reply.

"Ask me if I care! Ask me! Ask me!" she keeps shouting this as I leave the room.

Janet looks at me stunned as I plop in my chair.

"Rhonda again?" she asks.

"Yep...she's on another tangent.," I reply, grabbing my Salad bowl from my desk and poking around in it a little.

"This is always going to happen with patients." Janet says.

"Yes it will, especially ones like Rhonda." I say, not looking up from my salad.

The next night was even worse, with Rhonda on a tangent and another patient, Sam, looking worse than ever. So, I gave Rhonda some sleeping meds and went to Sam's room.

"Good morning, Sam." I say.

"Good morning, beautiful." he replies.

"Sam, we've been over this...I may look familiar but I am not your girlfriend." I say.

"Oh...right." he replies, rubbing his eyes.

"So, how's the pain level today?" I ask, pulling on some gloves.

"It's bad today. Maddie." he replies.

"Ok, I'll give you an extra dose of morphine and some sleeping meds to help you get through the pain." I say, adjusting the IV bag.

"Ok. thank you." he replies.

UPDATE:

I decided to post this after long thoughts about if. wanted to or not. As it turns out, the girl was right, Sam was on death's bed, but I was able to save his life before it was too late. He will be fine, thanks to that girl's giggling. She really does save lives!!
author: KKAndrews15
